text:
Jeremy James Hardy (17 July 1961 – 1 February 2019) was a British comedian. He was best known for his appearances on radio panel shows such as the "News Quiz" and "I'm Sorry I Haven't a Clue".
Hardy was a committed socialist, and a supporter of the Labour Party. He performed at Labour Party rallies and Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn called him a "dear, lifelong friend".
Hardy died of cancer on 1 February 2019, at the age of 57.
